subsection_content:
People with diabetic retinopathy often have no signs of abnormalities in the early stages. When the disease becomes more dangerous, its symptoms become clear, including:
Blurred vision.; Seeing bright or dark areas; Difficulty seeing at night; See blurred or blurred colors; Vision is narrowed.
If you see unusual signs in the eyes, people with diabetes need to go to the hospital for timely examination and treatment.
subsection_title: benh vong mac tieu duong.json. Symptoms of diabetic retinopathy

People with diabetic retinopathy often have no signs of abnormalities in the early stages. When the disease becomes more dangerous, its symptoms become clear, including:
Blurred vision.; Seeing bright or dark areas; Difficulty seeing at night; See blurred or blurred colors; Vision is narrowed.
If you see unusual signs in the eyes, people with diabetes need to go to the hospital for timely examination and treatment.
